alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 2:54AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 AM EST, the river gauge on Symmes Creek near Aid was at 20.0 feet, or approximately 1 foot above flood stage. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chesapeake and Aid. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
